title: Acadia National Park: Teacher Workshops
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Professional Development     Teacher Workshops                Teacher Workshops        Featuring an overview of current research, teachers assist with monitoring programs and explore marine, forest, and wetland studies in the field. NPS       BioBlitz Hosted by the Schoodic Institute, the goal of the BioBlitz is to collect, sort, and identify as many species of arthropods of a specific group as possible within a 24 hour period. It combines the collective efforts of experts, advanced amateurs, interested naturalists and beginners. All are welcome! The weekend event takes place in July and includes a free public program on Sunday. Find out more on our BioBlitz page.       Upcoming Workshops          Teachers investigate a tide pool while a ranger looks on. NPS  Stay tuned!      General Information       All lodging, meals, course materials, and in-class transportation provided. Lodging consists of air-conditioned dorm rooms (2 people/room) with a shared bathroom. Hot meals are served on campus with box lunches provided for field trips. Field trips will include moderate hikes on the peninsula and at various locations across Mount Desert Island, travel by van, wading in shallow wetlands and coastal habitats.
